sentences.en: A snap election would be to their disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 提前选举将对他们不利。

sentences.en: But there is a disadvantage to be set against this fact.
sentences.cn: 尽管事实如此,相比之下,仍有不利之处.

sentences.en: Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

sentences.en: England's players would be left at a disadvantage against those of the rest of the world.
sentences.cn: 英格兰运动员与世界其他地区的运动员相比将处于不利境地。

sentences.en: He may be able to nullify that disadvantage by offering a wider variety of produce.
sentences.cn: 他也许能通过供应更为多样化的农产品来抵消那一劣势。

sentences.en: Her ignorance of the area put her at a decided disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 她对该地区一无所知，这显然对她不利。

sentences.en: His bad health is a great disadvantage to him.
sentences.cn: 他身体不好是他的不利之处.

sentences.en: his poor educational track record inevitably worked to his disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 他很差的学习成绩记录肯定会对他不利。

sentences.en: His two main rivals suffer the disadvantage of having been long-term political exiles.
sentences.cn: 他的两个主要竞争对手因长期政治流亡而处于不利的地位。

sentences.en: It will be to our mutual disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 那将对我们双方都不利.

sentences.en: My father thought that I'd be at a disadvantage if I wrote left-handed.
sentences.cn: 我爸觉得我如果用左手写字，将来会吃亏的。

sentences.en: stringent regulations have &B{put} British farmers &B{at a disadvantage}.
sentences.cn: 严格的规定使得英国的农民处于不利地位。

sentences.en: The fact that I was a foreigner was a big disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 我是外国人这事实对我十分不利。

sentences.en: The Home Secretary aims to break the vicious circle between disadvantage and crime.
sentences.cn: 内政大臣力图打破贫困和犯罪之间的恶性循环。

sentences.en: The polytechnics have hitherto been at an unfair disadvantage in competing for pupils and money.
sentences.cn: 到目前为止，理工专科学校在争取生源和资金方面一直处于劣势。

sentences.en: They are privileging a tiny number to the disadvantage of the rest.
sentences.cn: 他们优待少数几个人，使其他人处于不利的境地。

sentences.en: We were put at a disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 我们被置于不利的地位.

sentences.en: We were put at a serious disadvantage.
sentences.cn: 我们被置于非常不利的地位.

words.tran_cn: 贫困的；处于不利地位的；社会地位低下的
使处于不利地位（disadvantage的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_en: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effective
